title: Exelon: Nuclear Power Plant Digital Twin

content_sections.content: Connecting IoT sensors, machine learning, and augmented reality to make better decisions

Nuclear engineers and managers are under pressure to make critical decisions when their power plant is operating with suboptimal conditions. Delays in this decision-making process have damaging effects. Because the data that inform these pressured decisions are often buried in reports, spreadsheets or isolated dashboards, it is time-consuming to digest and difficult to comprehend.

To solve this, I designed a digital replica of the plant that workers can monitor from anywhere. The solution exposes the plant’s hidden data and displays them in a way that alleviates stress and enables predictive maintenance. It was described as a 3D command center for these managers.

We moved from inception to functional prototype in 4 weeks with a team of four. My work included the storyboard, layout, Unity prototype, and visual design.
Improve visibility into real-time status of plant and system health and asset utilization
